elements.title: George Griffith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that George Griffith (pictured) wrote a book about the Boer War three years before it started?

elements.title: there being an estimated ten times more of them (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Siberian crane is considered more threatened than the whooping crane, despite there being an estimated ten times more of them?

elements.title: John Ogilby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that John Ogilby saved the manuscript of his translation of the complete works of Virgil from destruction in a shipwreck by wrapping it in a waterproof cloth?

elements.title: public TV to Indianapolis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an "army" of women were congratulated by Pat Nixon for their fundraising efforts to bring public TV to Indianapolis?

elements.title: Barry Windsor-Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that comic book artist Barry Windsor-Smith wrote, drew, inked, and lettered every page of his graphic novel Monsters by himself?

elements.title: a Harvey's franchise (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Harvey's franchise known for being a hub for sex work was described by one artist as a "legendary Toronto icon"?

elements.title: William J. Ennis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William J. Ennis's office consisted of a folding bed?

elements.title: winnowing basket (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there is a folk tradition in Korea where children who urinate while sleeping are made to wear a winnowing basket on their head and ask their neighbors for salt?
